item.title: CVE-2018-16838|2024-08-05T10:32:54.014Z -- %5Bunknown%5D -- sssd
item.description: A flaw was found in sssd Group Policy Objects implementation. When the GPO is not readable by SSSD due to a too strict permission settings on the server side, SSSD will allow all authenticated users to login instead of denying access.

item.title: CVE-2018-16883|2024-08-05T10:32:54.202Z -- %5Bunknown%5D -- sssd
item.description: sssd versions from 1.13.0 to before 2.0.0 did not properly restrict access to the infopipe according to the "allowed_uids" configuration parameter. If sensitive information were stored in the user directory, this could be inadvertently disclosed to local attackers.

item.title: CVE-2018-10852|2024-08-05T07:46:47.244Z -- %5Bunknown%5D -- sssd
item.description: The UNIX pipe which sudo uses to contact SSSD and read the available sudo rules from SSSD has too wide permissions, which means that anyone who can send a message using the same raw protocol that sudo and SSSD use can read the sudo rules available for any user. This affects versions of SSSD before 1.16.3.
